comment.author: 21647809@N04
comment._content: The span poles for the tramway overhead were removed in 1907-08 to make way for wide bodies cars which dates this pre-1910

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: Here's a fascinating 1906 T&CJ article/advert on DJ's...per this article two stories had recently been added to the building...which we see in the pic on p.33 - nla.gov.au/nla.news-page5725918...per this item nla.gov.au/nla.news-article14731744 the contract to build the additional stories was signed in January 1906...so presumably the work would have been underway soon afterwards if it was to be completed by August...now I just need a time machine...I'm after a properly made pair of duds and a decent pair of shoes...can't get em anywhere nowadays! I gather DJs had been trading at the corner of George and Barrack Streets since early 1887...Per this March 1887 SMH report, DJs 'splendid new premises' at George and Barrack Sts were then nearing completion - nla.gov.au/nla.news-article28355835 We also see DJs in this pic - www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2554622065/ In this pic we see DJs as it looked after the additional stories were added - www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2667026340/
